CatDescriptText: The Darlings of Rhythm played at Roosevelt Theatre April 18-19, 1945, which is likely the performance pictured; however they also played October 22, 1945 at Palomar Ballroom in Pittsburgh, October 25, 1945 in Uniontown, and March 30, 1946 in Canonsburg.Text of advertisement in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 14, 1945, pg. 21, reads: "Roosevelt Theatre (The Show Place of the Hill) 1862 Centre Avenue, Pittsburgh, PA. - 2 Big Days, Wednesday and Thursday, April 18, 19 - Ferguson Bros. Agency, Inc. presents America's No. 1 All-Girl Orchestra, The Darlings of Rhythm, 'The Toast from Coast to Coast,' on their annual tour - New York to California, has proved a consistent box office attraction - big halls, big crowds - little halls, standing room only! The Cream of Talent Beauty and Charm.  Plus 'Zelda' (The Queen of Sheba) - Toots Hoy (Comic Master of Ceremonies) 'Ophelia' - 'Chubby' and 'Wally' - 5 Big Acts."
TitMainTitle: Comedian wearing short pants and plaid jacket, performing in front of the Darlings of Rhythm jazz band, including Hetty or Hettie Smith on drums, Myrtle Young on saxophone second from right, and Lula Roberts on saxophone on right, possibly at Roosevelt Theatre
